title: Graham Johnson (cricketer, born 1946)
text:
Graham William Johnson (born 8 November 1946) is a former English cricketer and business executive. He played for <a href="Kent%20County%20Cricket%20Club">Kent County Cricket Club</a> between 1965 and 1985 and was later the chairman of the club's Cricket Committee. He was born in <a href="Beckenham">Beckenham</a> in 1946.
Johnson made his <a href="first-class%20cricket">first-class cricket</a> debut in 1965 and won his <a href="county%20cap">county cap</a> in 1970. He was a versatile batsman and off-spin bowler who featured in a strong Kent team which won four <a href="County%20Championship">County Championship</a>s and a number of limited overs trophies during his time with the club. He was vice-captain of the Kent side under <a href="Mike%20Denness">Mike Denness</a>.
A graduate of the <a href="London%20School%20of%20Economics">London School of Economics</a>, Johnson had a successful business career with Barclays Bank, Save and Prosper, Flemings, Egg and Prudential. He has been a director of TAL Talent Ltd, a specialist search, recruitment, assessment and people development company.
Johnson has also been active with the Lord's Taverners both on its Cricket Committee and as a player. He succeeded Denness as Chairman of the Kent Cricket Committee in 2004 and served as Kent President in 2014.
